name: Zesty Cheese Steak Sloppy Joes
author: Emily Tyner
summary: These have the flavor of our favorite restaurant cheese steaks (from PepperJax), but with the simplicity of ground beef and other kitchen staples that make this dish as easy and economical as it is delicious.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
¼ cup steak sauce (such as A1®)
1 teaspoon Creole seasoning (such as Tony Chachere's®), or to taste
1 (16 ounce) package wheat hamburger buns, split and toasted
directions: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat
Add onion and bell pepper; saute until soft, 5 to 7 minutes
Add ground beef, garlic, salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper
Cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly, 7 to 8 minutes
Add broth, steak sauce, Worcestershire sauce, jalapeno peppers and juice, and 1/2 teaspoon Creole seasoning; stir to combine, then bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes
Meanwhile, mix cornstarch and water together in a small bowl
Add cornstarch slurry to beef mixture and cook to desired consistency, 1 to 2 minutes
Taste and add additional Creole seasoning and pepper if needed
Melt 1 slice of provolone cheese on top of the meat
Scoop the meat from under the provolone and place on a toasted bun
Repeat with remaining cheese and buns and serve immediately
